name: Hotel National, A Luxury Collection Hotel

reviews.text: I have just returned from a brief stay at the National Hotel in Moscow, my first visit to the city. Service and facilities were both excellent, and the area is perfectly safe. The review posted on your site on November 1 2004 is maliciously misleading.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: First, the location of this wonderful hotel is probably the best in Moscow. Just across the street from the Kremlin, and a 5 minute walk to St. Basil's, Lenin's tomb, the history museum, and the GUM. A metro station is at the entrance to the hotel, and a great shopping street runs alongside. Arbat area is about a 15 minute walk and we were able to do all this in cold, snowy weather.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: Next, the staff is top-rate. From Victor the friendly, info-filled doorman, to Sergie and Max in the breakfast buffet room who brought us a complementary bottle of champagne to celebrate my husband's birthday, to the excellent concierges who provided A+ recommendations for leisure and dining, all the way to room service and housekeeping staff we received only the best of service.
reviews.title: True service

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it is probably the best located hotel in Moscow. It sits on the corner site immediately opposite the Kremlin and a minutes walk through the underground station to Red Square itself.
reviews.title: Luxurious and Perfectly Located Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to get to the hotel by the great Moscow Metro, which is not to be missed, then alight at Okhotny Ryad station on the Sokolnicheskaya Line.The Hotel is seconds from the entrance. The lobby is grand and the lobby bar is very comfortable ( avoid the pomegranate juice at £18! )
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were not as big as the ones we enjoyed in St Petersburg for less but you pay for location and history here. The corridor leading to the breakfast room is lined with photos of past esteemed guests of this Hotel including Winston Churchill and Sophie Loren!
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When in Moscow ask the concierge for the name of the best Georgian restaurant and they will direct you to a lovely place two metro stations away. Also try Uzbec restaurant, which is walkable from th ehotel for traditional Uzbekhistan cuisine and dancing. Food is very good.
reviews.title: My Birthday Surprise

reviews.text: Went on the 9.30pm BA Flight from London which arrived at 4.30am. Hotel was about an hour away from Dom airport. Cost 1700 roubles from a desk at airport.
reviews.title: Putin's neighborhood
Grand traditional hotel next to Red Square
reviews.text: Stayed in the Le Royal Meridien National hotel four times during Dec 2005/Sept/Oct/Nov 2006 on business trips. Each stay was a good experience. Note that Le Meridien is now part of the Starwood hotel chain, so guests with membership in Starwood's Preferred guest program get full benefits. (If you have status be sure to ask about a room upgrade at check-in.) My first stay was before Le Meridien joined Starwood, and I was in a single room. It was moderate size for European standards, with a twin bed. My further stays saw me upgraded to "business suite" rooms, which are quite large and have separate sleeping areas. Each of the 3 "business suites" was a different layout, but all had very high ceilings (12+ feet) and historical details like heavy mouldings, classic art work, antique-looking furniture, etc.. Bathrooms were all spacious, with large tubs and overhead showers. Some rooms could have done with less furniture, but that's just me. Housekeeping was impeccable. The desk staff and restaurant staff are all comfortable in basic English. Internet access requires you to buy an access card at the front desk, and it's expensive compared to finding an internet cafe. If you need to do a serious amount of work, pay for hotel access. A quick e-mail check would be better at an internet cafe. Note that if you buy 3 hours of internet time at the hotel, it's 3 *continuous* hours - you cannot use one hour today, one tomorrow, etc.. The hotel has a FANTASTIC breakfast buffet, in a restaurant overlooking Red Square. Food covers American/English breakfast style, European meat/cheese, some Asian fish... and you may also order off of the menu. There is a juicing machine on the buffet, so you can have really fresh juice if desired. Breakfast was included in my room rate, so can't quote the price. There are two other restaurants in the hotel, the Atrium and a more formal restaurant. The Atrium is good for a quick bite (soup, sandwich), but check the juice prices before ordering. The cost of the mango juice is more than you'd expect. The formal restaurant had a big variance in quality - first visit was great, second (and last) was dreadful. (But to be fair, they took the inedible food off of the bill.) There are other restaurants in the area which are good for dinner, so explore a bit. (Suggest Cafe des Artistes, which is a short walk away. Expensive but good. Also, there is a "Coffee Bar" place nearby which serves good food and pastries at a reasonable price - local business people eat there. Go out hotel entrance, turn right, take first street on the right and the Coffee Bar will be on the left a short way up the road. English menu available.) Note that if you want to visit Red Square which is just the other side of a highway from the hotel, you must take the pedestrian tunnel under the highway. DO NOT TRY TO CROSS THE HIGHWAY ON FOOT!! It is not allowed, plus seriously dangerous.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights and cannot fault the excellent service.
Western rates for food/drinks but well worth it for the service, standard of rooms and surroundings.
reviews.title: An outstanding hotel overlooking the Kremlin.

reviews.text: Located a stones throw from Red Square and views of the Kremlin.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: The staff all spoke excellent english and were always friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: great location & excellent concierge

reviews.text: I travel a great deal but this was my first trip to Moscow. My initial reservation was at the Metropol but based on the poor reviews on this site and a recommendation from an American resident of Moscow I booked this hotel through a Russian travel agency for $275 per night. I met an American who comes to Moscow often and he told me that he is paying around $200 per night. I stayed 3 nights starting August 18th.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: I think if you are traveling to Moscow for the first time, like me, you have to be prepared for how expensive it is in this city. I must confess that I did not fully experience the city due to the fact that I was somewhat intimidated by everyone telling me that I must be very careful in Moscow and all the nightmarish stories I’ve heard.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.

likes.disliked: — Price of food and Internet service in hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very comfortable. The room is very small and looked into an enclosed roof! The bathroom is very clean, well stocked with amenities.
reviews.title: Flawless hotel. Best location. Great staff.
Absolutely WONDERFUL
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is excellent and as you enjoy it you will see the major attractions of Moscow .. Red Square, Kremlin etc. , pretty much across the street. It is a GREAT location. The subway station is just around the corner and you feel very secure. The hotel is very comfortable in a relaxed understated way and the staff is very accommodating.

Now the prices. I am sure that the prices in this hotel is not any different from other hotels in Moscow .. they seem to be in a “phase” where they will just list an outrageous price and figure that some fool ( yes like me ) or someone that passes it onto an expense account will pay for it. I opened the room service menu and the American breakfast is bit over $40 and, almost, every main course is over $40! Last night I ordered a hamburger in which I invested $ 24 plus tea at $10. The 24 hour charge for wireless is $30. No, I did not have the guts to send out the laundry.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location......and great service!!

description: Built in 1903 by famed Russian architect Alexander Ivanov, Hotel National has been an awe-inspiring historic landmark for more than a century. Located at the very heart of Moscow's historical, cultural and business center, the magnificent hotel opens spectacular vistas of the Kremlin and the Red Square.The historical grandeur and understated elegance of the property, together with the The Luxury Collection's signature services and state-of-the-art technology, makes Hotel National a favorite destination for sophisticated global explorers visiting Moscow.
